<<<code>>>: try {
FileWriter writer = new FileWriter("filename.txt", true);
PrintWriter printWriter = new PrintWriter(writer);
printWriter.write("new text");
printWriter.close();
} catch (IOException e) {
e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: To append text to an existing file in Java, you can use the FileWriter class and set the second parameter to true. This will truncate the file to the specified length if it exists, or create a new file if it doesn't exist. Then you can use a PrintWriter to write the new text to the file. Finally, make sure to close the PrintWriter to properly close the file.
